childrenExerciseStretching.title: Wall Chest Stretches
childrenExerciseStretching.description: 3 x 10 sec each. Choose between upper, middle and lower, depending on which you feel the best stretch.

childrenExerciseStretching.title: Sleeper Stretch (Shoulder Internal Rotators)
childrenExerciseStretching.description: 3 x 10-15 sec each. Lower arm starts at 90 degrees, and use opposite arm to push it down.

childrenExerciseStrengthening.title: Shoulder Flexion and Extension
childrenExerciseStrengthening.description: 3 x 10-12 each. Perform with resistance band (tie a knot on one end to step on) or water bottle. Don't compensate with other muscles, and maintain good posture.

childrenExerciseStrengthening.title: Shoulder External and Internal Rotation
childrenExerciseStrengthening.description: 3 x 10-12 each. Perform with resistance band or hand weight (e.g. water bottle).Keep elbow tucked and at 90 degrees. Don't compensate with other muscles, and maintain good posture.

childrenExerciseStrengthening.title: Shoulder Protraction and Retraction
childrenExerciseStrengthening.description: 2 x 10. Perform with resistance band if available. Push forward and hold for a few seconds, then retract and engage scapular muscles for a few seconds. Maintain good posture.

childrenExerciseStrengthening.title: Bicep Curls
childrenExerciseStrengthening.description: 3 x 10 each. Perform with resistance band or hand weight. Concentric (upward) and eccentric (downward) movement, can perform concentric movement by pulling upward with both hands.

childrenExerciseStrengthening.title: Rows
childrenExerciseStrengthening.description: 3 x 10-15 each. Perform with resistance band tied to a stationary object, or bent over with backpack or dumbbell. Maintain good posture.

childrenExerciseStrengthening.title: ABCs on the Wall
childrenExerciseStrengthening.description: Use a ball to draw the ABCs on the wall, holding tension against the ball. For scapular control.
